Reason: The configuration _d is performance-sensitive because it directly impacts the execution time and memory consumption of the system. It is used in critical functions like catena, compTweak, flap, paddWithZero, and truncate, as well as in the while loop for updating the hash. The configuration affects the size of the hash output, length of byte arrays, and number of iterations in the while loop, all of which are time-expensive and memory-expensive operations. Therefore, any changes to _d can lead to notable performance variations at the system level.
